p:
Antibody biosynthesis is induced primarily in response to virion proteins whose genes are expressed at the late stage of the VACV development cycle (
Table 1 ). To date, eight proteins (H3, B5, D8, L1, A17, A27, A28, and A33) have been identified as antigens that induce the production of virus-neutralizing antibodies [ 8, 25, 27- 29]. Involvement of other viral antigens in the development of a protective immune response has not been sufficiently studied. This indicates the incompleteness of our knowledge about the development of a humoral immune response to a smallpox immunization/orthopoxvirus infection.
